dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medium shot of The Planet Earth floating in space.  An  important-sounding NARRATOR begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the twenty-first century began,  human evolution was at a turning  point.  Natural selection, the process  by which the strongest, the smartest,  the fastest reproduced in greater  number than the rest, a process which  had once favored the noblest traits  of man... DISSOLVE on pictures of great historical figures, Galileo Leonardo.  DaVinci, Columbus, MLK Jr., etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now began to favor different traits... DISSOLVE on pictures of Geraldo, Joey Buttafuco, Kathy Le Gifford, the guy from "The Bachelor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While most science fiction of the  day predicted a future that was more  civilized and more intelligent... DISSOLVE on pictures of 1960s-sci-fi-style antiseptic fut Handsome scientists, pristine domed cities, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all signs indicated that the human  race was heading in the opposite  direction -- a dumbing down. We PAN from the images over to a bunch of modern-day dumb with fanny packs, standing in line at a TOMORROWLAND RIDE revealing that the images we just saw were from the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happen?  Evolution does  not make moral judgments.  Evolution  does not necessarily reward that  which is good or beautiful.  It simply  rewards those who reproduce the most.

dialogues.text: Shit.

THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE SCREEN is brimming with new generat of dumbass.  They are all speaking at once and multiplyin like rabbits, drowning out the yuppie couple.

Narrator's voice fades in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mighty hand would pull humanity from  the brink of self-destruction... It  was in the year 2004, in an army  base in Virginia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE BOWERS, 30s, is hunched over a test bench, soldering  iron in hand, concentrating intensely. We get a little closer and see Joe is holding the tip of soldering iron to a popcorn kernel.  The kernel pops, hit Joe in the eye.  Startled, Joe drops his hand onto a circ board, shocking himself, causing him to fall back onto hi stool. SERGEANT MILLER, 40s, with a noticeable BATTLE SCAR on hi lower lip, enters.  Another officer lingers by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's your lucky day Joe.  That  guy out there?  That's Officer Collins  from the Pentagon.  They're asking  you to volunteer for a top secret  experiment.  This could be a great  opportunity for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no thanks sir.  I've just got  six years 'til my pension and I don't  wanna do anything that might screw  it up. Miller looks at Joe, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Joe, there's something else  that comes with that pension,  something they don't tell you about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hollow empty feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollow empty feeling?
Idiocracy 7-1-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  I've seen it a thousand times --   It's the same feeling that trust  fund kids and lottery winners get.   It's the feeling you get when you've  got nothing to strive for, no  struggle... Drives some of 'em to  suicide.  You know how you get rid  of it?  You do something that matters,  you challenge yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry sir, but remember the last  time you had me challenge myself?   When I tried to rewire the sound  system in the Mess Hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Miller, WITHOUT THE SCAR ON HIS LOWER LIP, go up t microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing... One two- AAAAAAAGH! Miller is blown out of frame by a spark arcing off the  microphone on to his lower lip.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT
dialogues.text: Miller's hand unconsciously moves to the scar on his lowe lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I remember.  Look, I know  you don't like responsibility, just  wanna be left alone in your little  corner here, but the truth is, this  isn't much of a challenge.  It's  some kind of hibernation experiment.   You'd be getting paid to sleep for a  year.  It would be pretty hard to  screw this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, all the same sir, I kind  of like things the way they are. Miller sighs, disappointed.
Idiocracy 7-1-07 Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Joe, I wanted to give you the  opportunity to volunteer first.   Thought it would make you feel better  about yourself, but the fact is,  this is an assignment.  You've got  no choice. Off Joe's worried expression we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highly decorated officers sit around a conference table. OFFICER COLLINS is at the head of the table, holding a re giving a slide presentation.  He's a nerdy-creepy Army  Engineer in his 40s, with a big mustache that looks out o place on his wimpy face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, CNAPA, or Chronological  Noncompatibility and Peacetime Aging  has plagued the armed forces for  years.  Some of our best pilots,  soldiers and military leaders have  spent their entire careers without  ever seeing battle.  We've seen all  their talents and expensive training  go to waste during times of peace. The officers murmur agreement. A slide appears: HHP -- Top Secret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter the Human Hibernation Project,  designed to save our best men, frozen  in their prime, for when they're  needed most. The Officers are impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have selected two test subjects,  a male and a female. Collins clicks his remote.  We see a large, unflattering  picture of Joe.
Idiocracy 7-1-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Private Joe Bowers, an  electrician here on the base, not  one of our best men.  He was chosen  primarily because of how remarkably  average he is-- extremely average.   In every category. Collins clicks through several slides of bell curves for  intelligence, physical strength, etc. Joe is at the dead  center of each curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most average person in our entire  Army.  He also has no family --  unmarried, an only child, parents  deceased -- making him an ideal  candidate, with no one to ask any  nosy questions should something go  wrong with the experiment. Various officers nod, approving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a little less luck finding a  female volunteer with these  qualifications within our ranks, and  were forced to go into the private  sector. Collins clicks his remote.  There's a picture of RITA, a  pretty woman in her 20s, obviously a prostitute. The officers react, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rita.  Like Joe, she has no  immediate family.  She agreed to  participate in exchange for dropping  some criminal charges, and a small  fee. Collins cues up a slide of a pimp in full pimp regalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrangement with her pimp -- a  gentleman here in the D.C. area who  goes by the name, "Upgrade," which  he spells U-P-G-R-A-Y-E-Dd-, with  two 'D's, as he says, (air quotes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "For a double dose of this pimpin'".
Idiocracy 7-1-07 As Collins talks, he clicks through several slides of Upg in different outfits, showing off his jewelry, driving in Mercedes, etc. The Officers begin to shift uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upgrayed agreed to "loan" us Rita  for exactly a year, and keep quiet  in exchange for some leeway from  local police in running his "pimp  game."  First, however, there was  the difficult manner of gaining his  trust. A slide of Collins and Upgrayed sharing a giant bottle of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we skip to the technicals,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Let me just finish here... The other officers squirm as Collins clicks through slide of himself with Upgrayed, with ho's, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, a pimp's love is very  different from that of a square-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins! There's an awkward silence.  After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  We'll move on... It is a  fascinating world, though. Collins quickly clicks past more slides of himself with  Upgrayde.  And clicking some more.  And some more.  And s more.

dialogues.text: Jesus, Collins! Collins speeds through another dozen slides of Upgrayed a his hos The crowd rolls their eyes.  Finally, a slide of hibernation pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, the experiment is ready to  begin immediately.  If successful,  we believe humans could be stored in  a dry freeze" indefinitely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small on-base apartment.  Joe is packing up his place f his year-long absence and talking on the phone to his  girlfriend, SHARON.

dialogues.text: I'll tell you what, I'll make it up  to you.  I'll meet you at TJ Swan's,  one year and three days from now.   October 17th.

dialogues.text: Sharon is at her desk, a secretary's desk outside an offi She finishes the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Joe and Rita, the prostitute, are waiting to go through s medical tests.  Both are in Army-issue hospital gowns.  J is nervous, wound up.  Rita on the other hand, is bored,  hungover, doesn't want to be there.  Joe awkwardly tries strike up a conversation.

I had a neighbor who used to  make chainsaw sculptures and sell  'em at the flea market.  I guess I  don't really have much of an  imagination.  That's why I'm in the  Army.  Heh heh. Rita rubs her temples It looks like she had a rough night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urn, yeah.

dialogues.text: (short)

Collins hits a butto and milky orange liquid begins flowing through the IVs.

dialogues.text: See you in a year! Joe and Rita's eyes flutter and close.  They're out cold. The orderlies and the Doctor exit the room. After a beat, Collins follows.  He hits a button labeled Secret" and a facade drops from the ceiling, concealing t door.

dialogues.text: The office of a highly-decorated officer -- trophies,  commendations, etc. are everywhere.  Collins sits at his  desk doing paperwork.

dialogues.text: The Human Hibernation Project was  one of the army's most ambitious  projects.  But it was not immune  from the usual government bureaucracy.

We see a dumb looking kitchen worker pouring canned chick 'n' dumplings into a big pot, and lighting a little can o Sterno underneath. A teenage busboy swoops out a tablecloth over a nearby ta blowing out the Sterno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: As Joe and Rita lay dormant, the  years passed, and mankind became  stupider at a frightening rate. A chart depicting intelligence over time.  An animated li begins at the present time.  As it moves into the future, drops precipitously. DISSOLVE TO a few years in the future.  There's now an ug development of McMansions where the army base once stood. High-speed time-lapse of a building being built over the  site, finally revealing a new FUDDRUCKER'S. Time lapse fast-motion of Fuddrucker's being torn down to build an even bigger Futtbucker's, which is torn down to  build an even bigger Buttrucker's.

dialogues.text: Some scientists had high hopes for  genetic engineering.  But the efforts  were slow, misguided and quickly  overtaken by the declining  intelligence and exploding population. We see a baseball stadium.  The marquee outside announces "Championship Baseball." DISSOLVE to a marquee reading  "Extreme Baseball."  Inside, a runner is caught in a rund between second and third.  Instead of gloves, the second third basemen brandish bats menacingly.  In the backgroun various players are engaged in batfights that seem to hav little connection to the game.

Idiocracy 7-1-07 Outside, the marquee DISSOLVES again, this time it just r "FIRE." We see huge flames rising up from the center of t stadium as the crowd goes berserk. DISSOLVE on calendar pages turning, over images of gradua more stupid-looking people, starting with dumbasses of th present, continuing to future dumbasses. The calendar pages stop somewhere in the 2900s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In silhouette, we see a magnificent vista that calls to m the alps or the Grand Tetons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plagues and World Wars came and went,  and by simply being unconscious for  several hundred years, Joe had managed  to become something neither he, nor  anyone who had ever known him, thought  he had the potential to become...  the smartest person on Earth... As the sun rises, we see that this is not a natural mount range -- it is a huge, stinking mountain of garbage,  ridiculously steep and unstable, the result of centuries stacking garbage with no plan whatsoever.  We are definit in the future.

dialogues.text: The highest peak.  A truck winds its way up a small road, Dr. Suess-looking path carved into the side of an absurdl steep face. At the wheel of the truck is the DRIVER, the dumbest look guy you've ever seen, a fat gum-drop-headed guy, with a w futuristic haircut, an ugly uniform and the McDonalds gol arches tattooed on his forehead. He is looking at a porn magazine while he drives.  He  alternates between excited grunts from the porn and start grunts as he nearly swerves off the road. The driver manages to navigate the truck to the summit. parks it, pulls a lever and the garbage begins to unload, causing the mountain to quiver under the new extra weight The driver cracks a beer and watches.  In the background see an OMINOUS BLACK DUST STORM of epic proportions  approaching -- like the Great Dust Bowl.

Idiocracy 7-1-07 The truck finishes unloading and the driver tosses his em can on top, but the dusty wind knocks it back down.  The  driver tries again.  And again.  Frustrated, he finally t the can and plants it forcefully on top, causing the smal peak to collapse, which causes the next part below to  collapse, and a chain reaction on down the mountain.  It one beer can more than this mountain was designed to hold In a WIDER SHOT, we see a huge, epic

They pay no attention to Joe's pod. Suddenly, the ground RUMBLES.  Another wave of garbage co roaring down the street, smashing into Joe's pod, sending flying into the air.

He stands up, brushes himself off, then notices  something: a huge wrecking ball swinging right towards hi balls.  He stands there like a deer caught in the headlig then WHAM, right in the balls. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priiiiiiiiiisonnnnnnnn!!!! Joe, miserable, looks at the screaming crowd.  Bailiffs grab Joe roughly and haul him off.

dialogues.text: Joe is in line with his police escort.  Various other peo are in various lines getting passports, driver's licenses etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the identity processing  program of America! Please insert  your arm in the arm receptacle! Joe slides his arm into a hole in the machine. His arm  disappears into the machine up to his elbow. We hear the  machine tighten its grip on Joe like a blood pressure mac he isn't going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Please speak your name as  it appears on your current federal  identity card, document number 2...  4... G... 3. Joe looks totally puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if I have an identity  card. But my name is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have entered the name... NOT  SURE. Is this correct, NOT SURE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! It's not correct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! "Not" is correct! Is "Sure"  correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??  No!  No,it's not! Go back!   Cancel!  You've got the wrong name!  My name Joe Bowers! Not "Not Sure"--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have already confirmed your first  name is "Not"! Please confirm your  last name, "Sure"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! My last name is not "Sure"! I  mean-- no, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Not Sure!  Your  confirmation is complete! Please  wait a minute while I tattoo your  new identity on your arm! Panicked, Joe tries to yank his arm out of the machine. I won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Stop!  Give me my arm back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy!
Idiocracy 7-1-07 The machine begins tattooing Joe's arm. It's very painful We hear loud buzzing sounds. Joe tries to pull his hand o to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: A progress bar indicates Joe's tattoo is almost done. As Joe screams and pummels the computer with his free han a camera flash goes off. We see a picture of Joe's face  twisted in anger on the monitor with Sure, Not" printed a with his height, eye color, fingerprints, etc. Like a dri license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, NOT SURE. Your  identification file is now complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bland federal building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Gotta get your IQ and  appatude tests.

dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To figure out what your appatude is  good at-and get you your jail job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of people are sitting at testing stations wearing  headphones. They're doing dumb little tests like putting pegs into ho matching colored blocks, touching their noses, etc. Joe is sitting at one of the testing stations, wearing a  pair of headphones. Next to him, a guy is furiously tryin to jam a round peg into a square hole. We hear the voice  coming from Joe's headphones:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have one bucket that holds  two gallons and another bucket that  holds five gallons, how many buckets  do you have?
Idiocracy 7-1-07 Joe looks confused, like it shouldn't be that easy, then  leans towards a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sits in a bus full of the scariest degenerates you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners are herded off the bus and into the prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is shoved into a room where PRISON GUARDS are prepari new inmates for life in prison -- they're taking their  clothes, giving them uniforms and sending them into vario lines -- Maximum Security, Minimum Security, Parole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ttoo. Joe holds out his hand. The Guard scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there. The Guard shoves Joe towards one of the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the Prison Exercise Yard, a scary, angry 400-pound man is sitting, naked, on the ground.  His horrible folds fat cover up what we can only assume are the world's most disgusting genitals. A closer look reveals that he is actually sitting on the  face of some poor bastard trapped beneath him. The trappe man's legs kick futilely. Joe stares in disbelief at this horrific image. The man  catches Joe looking, points to the guy below him and clea mouths "You're next." Joe recoils. Joe is now at the front of the line, looking panicked. He about to be sent off to lockdown. Desperate and terrified he gets an idea.
Idiocracy 7-1-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to guard, tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, actually... I'm getting out of  prison today? A beat. The guard just stares at Joe, trying hard to proc this... then smacks Joe upside the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the wrong line, dumbass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh... I'm a big dumbass. Sorry. The guard grabs Joe, buzzes him through a security gate,  then shoves him into the "parole" line. A third guard scans Joe's UPC and checks his computer  terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Uh, yeah. I don't see you in  here, so you're gonna have to, uh,  stay in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you check again? 'Cause I was,  like, definitely in prison. (points off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy sat on my face and  everything. The guard looks off, then looks down at his terminal, get confused. The guard concentrates very hard, looking for J name. After a beat, Joe takes off running. Everyone just watche him go. Alarms start going off like crazy. Everyone just keeps standing around. The guards look conf and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is running as fast as he ever has. He seems to have p some distance between himself and the cops. But as he run past some kind of vending machine, we see an infrared bea silently scan his UPC.
Idiocracy 7-1-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stops for a moment, totally out of breath. He looks u and recognizes a familiar billboard -- the Carltons Cigar ad. He then notices his pod through the broken window of  Dizz's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz is sitting in front of the TV in his La-Z-John, eati marshmallowy goop with his hands from a giant tub labeled FOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're watching The Masturbation  Network. America's number one network  for 300 years!

dialogues.speaker: DIZZ'S FACE
dialogues.text: The TV starts pumping out some primitiv bootknocking jam. Dizz settles in, gets comfortable. The mood is broken by loud knock on the. door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go 'way! 'Bating! The knocking keeps going. Dizz gets up, not happy, and op the door. Joe runs in, slams the door and pulls down the shades. He looks around, totally paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! You just let me, an innocent  man, get thrown into jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... you broke my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... I could have you  disbarred. Then maybe you'd go to  jail for not having money. Dizz looks scared.

dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay look, you're the only person I  know. You gotta help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've been thinking -- it's  been a thousand years, someone's'  gotta have invented a way to travel  back in time by now. I mean, I think  they were pretty close, even back in  my day. Something with Einstein or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, like a time machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... Joe looks around, from Dizz's.slack face, to the tub of  "Food," to the TV. He slumps against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that was too much to hope  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, they got a time machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do? Are you sure? Can it take  me back to 2003?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's like really expensive  and it breaks all the time?  Cuz  some guy made it a long time ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care, you've gotta take me  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I supersize with you, but didn't  you go to jail for not having any  money?
Idiocracy 7-1-07 Joe is stumped. Then, a brainstorm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how about this?  You get me to  the time machine, and when I get  back home, I open a savings account  in your name. 1000 years later, it'll  be worth billions! Dizz stares at Joe blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz of the interest. You'll have  billions of dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like money. How many billions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making it up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Like, ten!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time machine costs 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then... 30! 30 billion dollars! Dizz chews it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if I had 30 and the time machine  cost 20... What's the minus of 20  and 30?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It' s, uh.... (seeing an opportunity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's 80 billion dollars,  Dizz. That's a mighty big minus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I like money. There's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police! Open the door! We're looking  for an escaped individual, goes by  the name, "Not Sure"! Dizz looks at Joe, then at the door, unsure of what to do
Idiocracy 7-1-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 billion. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's, uh... Somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coke machine in the vicinity caught  his 'ttoo, seemed to be heading for  this domicile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh... you can't come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can too! The cops start smashing down the door. Dizz and Joe look the broken window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go get my money. The two of them jump out the window just as the cops kick the door in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz and Joe land hard on the street and run towards Dizz car. They get in the car. Dizz starts it up.

dialogues.text: Cuz that wasn't really part of the  deal. A cop jumps out the window and starts running towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll throw in another ten  billion, just go! Dizz hits the gas. They peel out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz's electric car turns a corner. We hear sirens approa in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, her pod is up here on the right,  so she shouldn't be too far away...  I hope...

dialogues.text: Horny Guy negotiates with Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when are we gonna do it?  'Cause  you said 10,000 dollars an hour, and  it's been, like, three days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, soon baby. Why don't you  come back tomorrow? The guy peels off a bunch of 10,000 bills.

dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, baby, cuz when I finally  ut-i-lize you, you gonna be payin'  me. The guy leaves.

dialogues.text: (calling off)

dialogues.text: And you're still on the clock! Dizz' s car comes around a corner. Joe calls out.

dialogues.text: Huh? Ohhh yeah. What-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust clears. Dizz's' electric car putters through the city streets. We hear sirens fade in the distance. Joe lo around cautiously as Rita freaks out in the back seat.

dialogues.text: It's been a thousand years?!  Upgrayed's gonna kill me! He gets  mad when I'm a day late with his  money.

dialogues.text: Well, if you owed him money, you  don't have to worry Rita, he's been  dead hundreds of years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there's a time machine, not  back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Upgrayed. Upgrayed  don't care where the time machine is --  now, then, last week -- he'll find a  way to come get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you understand- Rita pulls a wad of bills out of her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised him I'd only be gone a  year. I've gotta get this back to  him.

Idiocracy 7-1-07 Joe picks up the money and looks at it. The $10,000 bill looks like a garish, over-detailed Maste album cover. In the center is a long-haired former presid with his arms around two bikini girls, a 40 in each hand, and a giant dollar sign gold necklace. Various slogans ar plastered around: "Ten Thousand bucks," "That's what I'm  talkin' about," "Gettin' Paid," "Haulin' Ass."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure this money is going to  be good back in 2003. Rita laughs knowingly, snatches the money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you tell that to Upgrayed...  Damn! A thousand years? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Maybe they just forgot  about us... Joe just shakes his head, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone must've forgotten about  us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bad, man. Really supersize  with you. Joe leans his arm out the window.

dialogues.text: As they pass an ATM machine, a light scans across Joe's U tattoo. Dizz's dashboard computer comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz Jeeter! You are harboring a  fugitive by the name of Not Sure! Joe's mug shot appears on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.text: It shut off my battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz, Joe and Rita abandon the stalled car and take off  running across. the street towards the first place they s a fancy nightclub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! We can hide in there! Joe, Rita and Dizz try to blend into the line leading int the club.  Inside, futuristically hip people are dancing having a great time. As the line moves forward, we see it leads up to a ROBO  BOUNCER ("Powered by OmniPal!") who scans each person's U and looks them up and down before admitting them into the club. The ROBO BOUNCER scans a guy's hand.  It speaks in the sa familiar Computer Voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are too... (hard-drive whirring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOR and UGLY to enter! The guy shuffles off. The bouncer scans a girl's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are too... FLAT CHESTED to enter! The girl looks shocked and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy! Joe, Dizz and Rita are next in line. Joe puts out his han then realizes, and tries to pull it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, what am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are too... WANTED BY THE POLICE!  Please wait here for incarceration!
Idiocracy 7-1-07 They take off running. A guy gets his hand scanned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are too... DARK SKINNED to enter!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Joe, Rita, Dizz hear a big noise. They turn and look down the street in horror as the police converge on Dizz's car and start blasting away at it with guns. The cops, dumb-looking and incredibly well-armed, are tot indiscriminate --shoulder-mounted missiles are straying i apartment buildings, etc. One cop has his shoulder-mounted missile on backwards. It fires out the back, goes straight up -- after a beat, a p crashes in the background. People get excited by the violence. They start cheering t cops on. Random fights start breaking out. Joe,  Rita, and Dizz run for their lives. They manage to a couple blocks between them and the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a corner, haggard. They are under a badly desi unfinished freeway overpass -- way too many levels, piles unused hardened concrete, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much further is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few miles I think. Rita sags, Joe leans against the side of pillar, rubbing head, squinting at the early morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. I'm still groggy. 1000 yeas  of sleep... Boy, I could really go  for a Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I don't think we got  time for a handjob right now. Joe and Rita look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Walmart's up there, they got  a shuttle that'll take us right near  the time machine. Dizz points to a mind-bogglingly gigantic Walmart surroun by a shantytown of homeless people. Joe and Dizz take off running towards the Walmart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, Dizz and Rita make their way towards the front gate. they get there, they see 20 cops pull up. They quickly tr to disappear into the crowd of beggars. Joe and Dizz push through the mob of starving homeless people clamoring to in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let them see my tattoo, so  you pay for us, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, okay. Dizz's runs his hand over a scanner next to the front  entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz Jeeter! You were harboring a  fugitive today! Are you still  harboring a fugitive? Dizz looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, "no"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Do you know the whereabouts  of fugitive Not Sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! The three enter through the automatic revolving door. As they exit, a feeble, elderly lady approaches the entra on her walker. She scans her UPC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velveeta Jordan! Have you seen any  dangerous criminals in the vicinity?

dialogues.text: Well... I'm not sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! You are "Not Sure"! You  are a wanted criminal! Suddenly, the revolving door clamps shut, trapping Velvee inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please step away from the criminal  while I notify authorities! Sorry  for the inconvenience! The frightened old woman starts banging on the glass. We HOLD on the revolving door as several cops hack it ope with axes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! We got him! The cops grab Velveeta, roughly throw her to the ground, hog-tie her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, Rita and Dizz walk into a huge marketplace. It stret the length of several football fields. It has everything  from Tvs to herds of goats. It is lit mostly by a huge ro out hole in the ceiling. They jog by the GREETER on their way to. the main shoppin area.

dialogues.text: (rote)

Idiocracy 7-1-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.text: Um... Thanks. As other patrons enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Walmart, I love you...  Welcome to Walmart, I love you...

dialogues.text: Shuttle bus is over near electronics.   It's 'bout a half a mile from here.

dialogues.text: Joe, Rita and Dizz are still running through Walmart. We many shops within shops. They pass a "Yogurt, My Ass!"  franchise, and a "Starbucks Exotic Coffee for Men" with a line of guys out the door. A sign reads, "Latte, $2000. 'Extra Foam' $500,000,000." Scantily-clad baristas help  customers. Dizz slows down, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been running forever. How much  further is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout half a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said an hour ago!  Are you sure you know where we're  going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know this place pretty good.  I went to law school here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Walmart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Got a fart scholarship.

dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fart scholarship.  Took the fart  team to nationals in '68. 'Course  that was when I was in shape. I gotta  slow down. They slow to a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, Rita and Dizz walk through a huge appliance area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you guys wanna go back so  bad? When I studied history in school,  they said the past was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe it was, but at least I  wasn't wanted by the police... (wistful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also had a pension coming, and a  pretty nice girlfriend who probably  died thinking I stood her up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got no choice. Upgrayed's  gonna be so pissed off if I don't  get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita, I'm not sure you understand  this completely--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuttle comes every few minutes.  Shouldn't be too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have time to use the bathroom? Dizz starts laughing stupidly . Rita rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.
Idiocracy 7-1-07 Rita leaves, (back in the direction they came from) Joe a Dizz wait. Dizz checks her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hornily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. She's hot.. You mind if I hit  that? I like having sex with chicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think everyone does, Dizz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I like it a lot. Ooooh... Joe looks on, kind of disturbed, as Dizz breaks into a we booty dance, making an embarrassing, primitive sex face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filthy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, yeah!! The dance goes on a couple beats beyond what is funny. Pe start to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz... Cut it out! You're gonna get  us caught I As Joe waves his hand, trying to get Dizz to stop, we see TV in the furniture section scan Joe's tattoo. ALL THE TVS COME TO LIFE.

The Assblaster and the Bitchmaker position themselves on  opposite sides of Joe, and get ready to smash him. Joe  frantically tries to restart his car.
Idiocracy 7-1-07

Then, at the last second Joe's engine turns o just enough to lurch the car forward, out of the way. The two trucks collide.  The Assblaster's jackhammer gets chewed up by the Bitchmaker's rotoblades, sending shrapne into the Bitchmaker's cockpit, KNOCKING OUT THE BITCHMAKE DRIVER.  Joe breathes a sigh of relief, until he gets ram by the Dildozer from behind, sending his car flipping and bouncing several times. The crowd goes nuts. Joe's car lands upside-down. It looks like it's all over. But then he sees that his steering wheel has broken off,  enabling him to leave the car. He climbs out, his left ha still cuffed to the broken-off steering wheel.  He takes running, narrowly escaping as the Dildozer pulverizes wha left of his car.. The crowd's loving it. The Assblaster backs up and stops. The crowd goes wild,  yelling some kind of one syllable chant that sounds vague like "dogs." Joe looks confused. Then a hatch falls open the back of the Assblaster, dumping a load of PIT BULLS t size of small horses on the arena floor.

dialogues.text: Rita and Dizz come running in. Rita gets as close as secu will allow her to the Presidential box, and yells down to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his groupies)

dialogues.text: That chick wants me.

dialogues.text: Joe-- I mean Not Sure -- was right!  It worked! The crops are growing! Camacho yells back to Rita, condescending.

dialogues.text: Sure they are. You gotta wait your  turn baby. There's enough President  for everyone. Rita sees Joe on the Jumbotron. She looks down a few rows and sees a CAMERAMAN in the press area, covering the acti She gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizz, go get that guy with the camera  and take him to those crops we saw.  Tell him to broadcast it everywhere. She pulls a big wad of money out of her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him this! Bribe him! I'm gonna  try to stop this thing.' Dizz runs off. Rita yells to Camacho.

dialogues.text: Hey, isn't that Not Sure's 'ho?

dialogues.text: What if she's right? The president considers for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Rita looks up at the Jumbotron, hoping.

dialogues.text: Whoa!  Look. DIZZ'S POV: A Starbucks. A blinking sign that says, "1/2

dialogues.text: Joe holds on to the rope for dear life. Be strains to hol on, losing his grip. The Dildozer makes another pass at h Joe yells to the driver:

The Dildo enters frame, slamming into the Assblaster and knocking h upsidedown. ON RITA, still being held back by security. She watches J looks up at the Jumbotron.

Joe barely pulls himself back up, but he no more strength. The Dildozer circles around, dramatically prolonging the  kill. The crowd starts chanting "Grease! Grease! Grease!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What do ya keep readin' that word  for? You a fag? The word "fag" seems to have jarred Dizz's memory. Words  echo in his mind, "fag," "Rehabilition," "Not Sure!"

dialogues.text: The Grease slips slowly down the rope to where Joe's hand are, making it too slick to hold on to. He starts to slow slide down. He falls off the rope, lands in the dirt. ON Joe, staggers up, getting ready to run, or dodge the  Dildozer. ON RITA. She turns away, not wanting to watch Joe get kil As she looks down, we hear the cheers of the crowd sudden turn to CONFUSED MURMURS. Rita allows herself a peek.

Camacho and the Cabinet  Members start to put it together. The driver of the Dildozer, expecting cheers of bloodlust confused by the quiet murmurs.  He too looks up at the  Jumbotron. The Dilldozer's driver doesn't see it coming.

Joe sees the driver is stuck in the burning Dilldozer. He watches for a beat. Be looks conflicted and then realizes has to save him. He runs over and pulls the Driver out. But as soon as the Driver is safe, he immediately starts beating the shit ou of Joe. Then the Driver grabs an axel rod, comes back ove to finish Joe off. President Camacho and the Cabinet Members see this. They  jump out of their box seats, Camacho in the lead, climb i the arena and pull the driver off, and beat his ass down, rescuing Joe.  Camacho raises Joe's hand in victory, poin at the sprouts on the Jumbotron. The crowd cheers Joe.

The high-pressure stream nails him in the balls, lifting him in the air, hurling him 30 feet. H lands crotch-first on a cactus.

dialogues.text: Ow!  My balls! Joe, Dizz and Rita all have a good LAUGH. Joe scoops a bi bite of Food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: He still owes me 2,000 dollars.

dialogues.text: Starbucks? You're still gonna paint,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Well, I guess this is goodbye then... Rita's sad to see him go, but she can't quite admit it. Joe, also sad, stands awkwardly, not sure what to say.
Idiocracy 7-1-07 DIZZ watches them, laughing hornily. Finally, Joe shakes her hand, then picks up his suitcase, getting ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joe? If you ever meet Upgrayed,  promise me you'll still think of me  the way you think of me now? You  know, as a painter.

dialogues.text: You'll see. Spend a little time with  Upgrayed and you'll be surprised  what starts making sense. The Attorney General, The Secretary of Defense and the 14 year-old Secretary of the Interior enter, followed by a c little FIVE-YEAR-OLD BOY, smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.text: Hey guess what? Camacho's gonna make  you Vice President! They all start patting him on the back, congratulating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... You guys-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. When you switched to water?  And you turned off the computer?  Taxes aren't working now.

dialogues.text: Georgia's in Florida. Isn't it? Joe starts to look stressed, then gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.text: Ah, it's so complicated. The Cabinet members all groan, making various GIVING UP  NOISES.

dialogues.text: Well... so what if it's complicated!  The country's depending on you! Come  on you guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you can't just keep giving up  so easily. You've gotta take command.  Make decisions! Think about things!   If you don't, who will? More blank, confused stares from the Cabinet members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're just gonna leave us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (having a meltdown)

dialogues.text: But if I leave -- you guys'll... who  knows what'll happen to the world?.. Rita senses Joe is wavering. She gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: But I can't just... TJ Swan's- Rita walks over to Joe, determined, on a mission.

dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Okay.

dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.text: What's going--? Rita jams her tongue down his throat and throws him down the pool table. Joe doesn't put up much of a fight, goes  with it. The music we heard earlier on the Masturbation Network ki in, this time as score.

dialogues.text: Hey, this door's got a keyhole! He leans down to look, but Dizz knocks him out of the way like a football player, and starts watching. We don't hea Joe and Rita, but from the noises Dizz is making, we get idea that they're going at it pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh yeah!... Mmmmm yeah... Damn...  Way to go!... Utilize!  Yyyyyyyyeah!!!   Not Sure kicks ass!

dialogues.text: The Cabinet Members are all sitting around. Joe stumbles out. He's only wearing his underwear, but do seem to care. He looks a little happier and a tad stupide than he did before. He flops down in a chair, grabs a han of Food, and eats it, thoughtfully.

dialogues.text: You know... Maybe I don't need to go  to that time machine right away. Cabinet Members all cheer.

dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.text: Joe, Rita and Dizz sit strapped into a car on a track, li a typical amusement park ride, or haunted house. A Voice Over begins. Note: this is not the Computer Voice it's more like a Vincent Price horror movie voice.

dialogues.text: Welcome to the Time Machine. We are  going to take you back... Back! BACK!!  First, to the year 1939, when Charlie  Chaplin and his evil Nazi regime  enslaved Europe and tried to take  over the world! A spotlight goes on. dialogues.text: So you knew this thing was just a  ride the whole time?

dialogues.text: Yeah... You thought you could really  travel through time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Yeah. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooooh yeeeah... Shit. Joe looks at Rita.

dialogues.text: Well, I guess we're stuck here. Might  as well make the best of it.

dialogues.text: Fortunately, Charlie Chaplin's evil  career was cut short by cocaine  addiction... We see mug shots of Robert Downey, Jr. with a Charlie Cha mustache airbrushed on.

dialogues.text: Joe is giving a speech, being cheered by the Congressmen audience. Dizz is on one side of him and Rita on the othe

Under  President Not Sure's leadership, a  new era dawned... As the cheers subside, Joe continues his speech.

Idiocracy 7-1-07 Various people watching his speech people, "servers" in  Starbucks, shantytown, hospital

dialogues.text: ...You know, there was a time when  people didn't have computers.  It  wasn't easy, but they built airplanes,  and pyramids and ships...

dialogues.text: ... And there was a time in this  country, a long time ago, when reading  wasn't just for fags. And neither  was writing. People wrote books and  movies -- movies that had stories so  you cared about who's ass it was and  why it was farting...

dialogues.text: He's not so bad... for a fag.

dialogues.text: (on a roll)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I know these things aren't easy to  do.  I'm pretty lazy myself. But you  know, sometimes you have to challenge  yourself, and do something that  matters, cuz if you don't, you'll  wind up with a hollow empty feeling  inside. Beat.  The crowd looks a little confused.

dialogues.text: You mean like when you're hungry?

dialogues.text: (cracking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Not Sure! Not Sure! Not Sure! Joe grabs the same big gun President Camacho had and awkw shoots it in the air. The recoil almost knocks him down, the crowd goes nuts.

dialogues.text: Okay, so maybe Joe didn't exactly  save mankind, but he got the ball  rolling. And that's pretty damn good  for an Army Electrician. We PAN OVER to Rita, doing a HIDEOUSLY BAD OIL PAINTING, Joe looks on proudly. FADE OUT.

dialogues.text: We see another pod come to life, creaking open. We pullou to reveal UPGRAYED getting out of the pod. He rises, dust himself off, starts walking.
